answers: flood [accept descriptions indicating destruction by water]
parts: Name this Phrygian couple who realized that they were in the presence of divinity when Hermes made wine replenish with magic.
As gratitude for their treatment, Zeus and Hermes allowed Baucis and Philemon to survive this catastrophe which occurred in their town after they left without turning back.
At their request that that when one of them dies, the other would as well, Baucis and Philemon were transformed into these objects at their death.
Name this character who ate animals raw, culminating in him trying to feed successively larger animals to each other in hopes of gaining their life energy.
Renfield and Dr. Seward are characters in this novel. The nemesis of this novel’s titular character is Professor Abraham Van Helsing.
Three female vampires known as the weird women, are also known by this popular name. It also titles a 1960 Hammer film also about Abraham Van Helsing.

answers: “Peace for our Time” [do not accept “Peace in our time”]
Phoney War [or Drôle de guerre or Sitzkrieg] <Yoshida>
parts: Give this four word phrase that titles a speech concerning the Munich Agreement. Do not get it confused with a similar phrase used in the Book of Common Prayer and The Avengers: Age of Ultron.
“Peace for our time” was the phrase used by this British Prime Minister famous for his policy of appeasement. He led Britain through the first eight months of World War II.
The beginning of World War II was given this name by journalists. It was named because of a lack of large-scale military battles and seems like a name that would be given by Holden Caulfield.
Name this arrangement of the atomic elements by mass and into columns and rows with similar chemical properties.
This Russian chemist was the first to fully formulate the periodic table and make predictions through its trends, arranging the 56 known elements into eight groups he envisioned in a dream.

After Mendeleev’s publication, Horace Groves Deming published a new version of the periodic table with this many columns, in order to accomodate all valence electron possibilities for s, p, and d orbitals.

answers: nuclear strikes [or nuclear war or atomic bomb or similar]
parts: This legislation proposed a toll-free interstate system. Unfortunately, there was no suggested means of funding, and nothing happened for 12 years.
One justification for pursuing this expensive project was that the interstate system would serve as an escape route if this event were to occur. Description acceptable.
The interstate system was championed by this U.S. President. This five-star general served as the supreme commander of the Allied Expeditionary Forces in Europe during World War II.
Name this commonly-used cylindrical world map projection created by a Flemish geographer with a Latinized name, primarily used for navigational purposes.

On the Mercator projection, Alaska is about the same size as this nation which is actually about five times as large. This country contains the longest portion of the equator, and it borders all but two of the other countries in its continent.

In contrast to the Mercator projection, this German produced a namesake world map which was deemed more politically correct since it is flattened at the poles to yield equal areas throughout. Today that projection is named after James Gall and this man.

answers: The Glass Bead Game [or das Glasperlenspiel]
parts: Name this “kind of synthesis of human learning” whose universal symbols allowed masters like Joseph Knecht to create games starting from a Bach fugue subject and leading to “a sentence out of Leibniz or the Upanishads.”
Joseph Knecht and previous masters of the Glass Bead Game were given this Latin title, whose name blurs the distinction between its nature as a game and as a school.
The Glass Bead Game is the last full-length novel by this German author who also wrote Steppenwolf and Siddhartha.

answers: The Golden Ass [or Asinus Aureus or Metamorphoses of Apuleius]
parts: Name this novel in which Lucius tries to transform into a bird, only to be transformed into the titular animal. Give either title.
After eating a crown of roses held by a priest of this deity, Lucius is returned to human form. This is the name of the true form of the queen of heaven according to her.
An old woman in The Golden Ass tell the tale of these two lovers. This is one of the most famous sources for this tale, and includes talking towers and ants sorting grain.
Name this kingdom of small eukaryotes, which includes amoebae and red-tide-causing dinoflagellates.
The largest protist is this stramenopile commonly known as giant kelp. Its name refers to the presence of the pigment fucoxanthin.
These other stramenopiles are best known for their bilaterally-symmetric, rigid cell walls made of silica. Their high lipid metabolism makes them an excellent candidate for biofuel sources.

answers: Tom Sawyer Abroad [prompt on Tom Sawyer, I guess]
parts: Name this character who argues with his friend about the rights of religious leaders to take away people’s land in the name of their god, who appears in a novel named for that friend.

Huckleberry Finn, Tom Sawyer, and Jim are trapped on a hot air balloon in this novel, the third in a series centered around Huck’s friend. They make it all the way to Africa, and return rich, as usual.
Tom Sawyer Abroad is a novel by this American author.
Name this circuit element which, like a valve, allows current to flow in only one direction.
According to the hydraulic analogy, electric potential in a circuit is equivalent to this quantity for water in a pipe whose difference is equal to rho g delta h.

This circuit element’s water equivalent is a hydraulic accumulator, a tank with a flexible rubber diaphragm that stores energy by the stretching of the rubber sheet and that leaks out water after it has been filled from the front end.

answers: Edward the Black Prince [accept Edward of Woodstock]
parts: Name this man who was nicknamed because of the color of his armor.
At this 1349 naval battle, Edward’s ship was grappled by a Spanish ship and almost sank. He was rescued by Henry of Grosmont.
Edward and his brother John helped Pedro the Cruel win this decisive battle in the Castilian Civil War.

answers: The Art Institute of Chicago [prompt on AIC] <Yoshida>
parts: Name this Helnwein parody of Nighthawks featuring Marilyn Monroe, Humphrey Bogart, and James Dean.
Another Nighthawks parody is by this English graffiti artist. It depicts a drunk soccer fan after he breaks the window of the diner with a chair.
The original Nighthawks is held in this art museum. This museum is also home to Time Transfixed, The Old Guitarist, and American Gothic.
Give the Latin term for a person who comes from a family without prior consulship, which translates as, “new man.”
This man grew tired of populist antics, and tried to prevent the rise of the novus homo by formalizing the rules for the Cursus Honorum.

One way to gain favor with the people was to throw huge parties when serving as this magistrate. There were both Curule and Plebeian varieties of this position, which comes from the Latin for “temple edifice.”
Name this process whereby a function is applied within its own definition, useful in creating things like the Koch snowflake.
The Koch snowflake is a type of this thing, other types of which are named for Sierpinski and Mandelbrot.

The recursively-defined inductive dimension will always be less than or equal to this dimension of a fractal named for a German mathematician. For the Koch snowflake, this quantity is log-base-three of four, or about 1.26.

answers: monotheism [accept descriptions about belief in one God]
money [or wealth or similar answers indicating one’s possessions] <McMaken>
parts: Name this belief known in Islam as tawhid [tou-HEED], a belief about divine unity that is also expressed in the Jewish Shema.
In addition to the shahada, this other pillar of Islam is practiced five times a day, in which a Muslim prays while facing the Kaaba in Mecca.
Sawm [SOUM], or fasting, occurs in three different forms in the Quran—abstaining from food, words, and this other thing which is given away through the pillar of zakat [za-KAH].
Name this man who also designed the main terminal at Dulles International Airport.
Contrary to popular belief, this structure is the shape of a parabola. This Saarinen-designed structure sways when it is particularly windy.
Saarinen also designed one of these structures at MIT named for Sebastian S. Kresge.

answers: Eroica Symphony No. 3 [accept either underlined portion] <McMaken>
parts: Name this type of music that is exemplified by a namesake piano sonata by Chopin, his second in B-flat minor. It has a slow, duple meter imitating the solemn pace of a certain procession.
This composer’s Funeral March of a Marionette is perhaps best known for being the theme music to the television show Alfred Hitchcock Presents. This composer also wrote the opera Faust.
A “largely and amply developed” funeral march in the key of C minor gives the second movement of this Beethoven symphony written in the key of the march’s relative major.
Mount Pinatubo, located on this country’s island of Luzon, violently erupted in 1991, killing 847 people. This country’s capital, Manila, is located about 55 miles from Mt. Pinatubo.

This frequently erupting Italian volcano most recently erupted in 2017, injuring 10 people. The borders of eleven municipalities converge at the summit of this Sicilian volcano, making this volcano the most complicated multi-point in the world.

The emergence of this volcanic island in 1963 resulted in intense scientific analysis during and after its eruption. Located south of Iceland, this island is only expected to remain above sea level for another 100 years.
Name this Italian thinker who may be more famous for writing the line, “it is better to be feared than loved.”
One of Machiavelli’s more famous works is this one which focuses on the first 10 books of Ab Urbe Condita. He portrayed Rome and other old civilizations as a model for the politics of his time.
In Discourses, Machiavelli discusses the difference between religion and this concept. He argues that while religion was man made, this concept existed naturally.
This largest Asian desert is bordered to the north by the Altai Mountains and to the west by the Taklamakan Desert. The Chinese province of Inner Mongolia composes a large portion of this desert.

The Karakum Desert is primarily located within this Central Asian nation. Located between Uzbekistan to the north and Iran to the southwest, this nation is home to a large portion of the Amu Darya River and borders the Caspian Sea to its west.
The Thar Desert is primarily located within this largest Indian state. With capital at Jaipur, this state translate roughly to “land of kings” in its native Hindustani language.
